summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the voluntary interview of a BOP Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the circumstances surrounding the incarceration and death of Jeffrey Epstein. The Captain details Epstein's housing status, suicide watch history, the July 23 incident with his cellmate, and the failure to maintain a cellmate for him on the night of his death, August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate at MCC who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019. The interview details his housing, psychological assessments, manipulative behavior to avoid cellmates, and the July 23 incident where he accused his cellmate of an attack.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at MCC. On or about July 23, 2019, Epstein was found unresponsive and later claimed Tartaglione tried to take his life.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate selected to be Epstein's cellmate after the July 23 incident. He was in court on August 9, 2019, and his property was removed from the cell, leaving Epstein alone.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Correctional Officer who admitted to entering Epstein's cell without supervision on the morning of August 10, 2019, after Epstein was found unresponsive.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Correctional Officer who, along with Officer Thomas, admitted to not completing rounds and counts on the night of Epstein's death.

connections.description: Were cellmates at MCC. Epstein accused Tartaglione of trying to kill him during an incident on July 23, 2019.
Reyes was selected as Epstein's new cellmate after the incident with Tartaglione. Reyes was not in the cell on the night of Epstein's death due to being at court.
Both were Correctional Officers on duty who admitted to failing to complete required rounds and counts on the night of Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, flagged staff. Epstein later claimed Tartaglione tried to kill him.

events.title: Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was at court. Reyes's property was removed from the cell, leaving Epstein alone in his cell overnight, contrary to the Warden's directive that he always have a cellmate.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC in the early morning hours. He was pronounced dead. Staff admitted to not completing required 30-minute rounds and 3:00/5:00 AM counts.

events.title: Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: A BOP Captain at MCC was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents regarding the supervision and circumstances leading to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch after a July 23, 2019, incident where he was found unresponsive and accused his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, of an attack.

The Warden had issued a directive that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times. Despite this, on August 9, 2019, his cellmate Efrain Reyes was at court and his property was removed, leaving Epstein alone.
Correctional Officers Thomas and Noel admitted to not completing the required 30-minute rounds and 3:00 AM/5:00 AM inmate counts on the night of Epstein's death.
The camera system in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was held was reportedly down, and the Captain was not aware of this until the morning Epstein was found dead.
The Captain stated that communication about the directive for Epstein to have a cellmate was done informally and verbally to Lieutenants, and no formal meeting or email was sent to all staff.
